thread.title: Tracy Morgan announces new stand-up tour
thread.title_full: Tracy Morgan announces new stand-up tour - UPI.com

author: Wade Sheridan
title: Tracy Morgan announces new stand-up tour
text:
1 of 2 | License Photo HAMMOND, Ind., Oct. 20 (UPI) -- Tracy Morgan announced a new stand-up tour following his recent return to the stage since recovering from a June 2014 car crash.
The comedian, who recently hosted Saturday Night Live , will embark on the tour starting in February.
Morgan's Picking Up the Pieces tour will kick-off in Hammond, Ind., and will conclude May 28 in Westhampton Beach, N.Y. according to Morgan's official website .
The 46-year-old made the announcement on Twitter writing "Heading back out on the road to bring the funny. Come see me."
Heading back out on the road to bring the funny. Come see me: https://t.co/4fBhXf3CoB #pickingupthepieces 
â€” Tracy Morgan (@RealTracyMorgan) October 20, 2015 Morgan began his comeback on The Today Show in June and during the Emmys where he presented the award for Best Drama Series.
Morgan sustained broken ribs, a broken nose, head trauma and a broken leg in the crash on the New Jersey Turnpike in June 2014. Morgan's friend and fellow comedian James McNair was killed in the accident.
